FuncDef:
The avp nas-port enable command enables an LAC to encapsulate the NAS-Port attribute into the AVP100 field of an ICRQ message to be sent to an LNS and enables an LNS to parse the NAS-Port attribute carried in the AVP100 field of an ICRQ message received from an LAC.
The undo avp nas-port enable command disables an LAC from encapsulating the NAS-Port attribute into the AVP100 field of an ICRQ message to be sent to an LNS and disables an LNS from parsing the NAS-Port attribute carried in the AVP100 field of an ICRQ message received from an LAC.
By default, an LAC does not encapsulate the NAS-Port attribute into the AVP100 field of an ICRQ message to be sent to an LNS and an LNS does not parse the NAS-Port attribute carried in the AVP100 field of an ICRQ message received from an LAC.
ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
To enable an LAC to send the NAS-Port attribute to an LNS, run the avp nas-port enable command on the LAC or the LAC-side of an LTS so that the NAS-Port attribute is carried in the AVP100 field of an ICRQ message to be sent to the LNS. To enable an LNS to parse the NAS-Port attribute carried in the AVP100 field of an ICRQ message, run the avp nas-port enable command on the LNS or the LNS-side of an LTS.
